abstract: Apple introduced a new iTunes movie rental service and an ultralight, super-thin Mac notebook.
snippet: Apple introduced a new iTunes movie rental service and an ultralight, super-thin Mac notebook.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Apple on Tuesday introduced a movie rental service and an ultralight Mac notebook that could set a new industry standard for thinness.

headline.main: Apple Unveils Movie Rentals and Thin Notebook

abstract: A list of sites that are liveblogging the keynote by Steve Jobs at Macworld Expo
snippet: A list of sites that are liveblogging the keynote by Steve Jobs at Macworld Expo
lead_paragraph: Somehow there is more coverage of the Macworld Expo keynote by Steve Jobs than the State of the Union Address. Apple won’t allow the speech to be Webcast. But there are lots of sites that are live blogging. In addition to our coverage at Bits here are links to some liveblogs:

abstract: This is the Set-Top Box Generation. Many companies have an entry and consumers, while they may ultimately benefit, are left to figure out what to choose — how to hook up, whether and when to jump in.
snippet: This is the Set-Top Box Generation. Many companies have an entry and consumers, while they may ultimately benefit, are left to figure out what to choose — how to hook up, whether and when to jump in.
lead_paragraph: The iTunes movie rental announcement at Macworld Expo underscores that this is among the hot categories right now. It’s part of an earnest and chaotic effort by consumer electronics companies to both bring Internet content to the living room and to get themselves into the process and profit it from it.

headline.main: Can Apple Jump-Start Internet Movie Rentals?

abstract: Steve Jobs didn’t introduce all that much innovation at Macworld. But Apple can package the available technology and sell it like no other company.
snippet: Steve Jobs didn’t introduce all that much innovation at Macworld. But Apple can package the available technology and sell it like no other company.
lead_paragraph: Steve Jobs could take a tuna fish sandwich, wrap it in a shiny white box, and convince the world that a new era in lunch has begun.

abstract: A footnote to Apple’s presentation–the ability of the AppleTV to play video podcasts–may be the most important announcement because it opens a path for free, ad-supported programs from many sources to get onto televisions.
snippet: A footnote to Apple’s presentation–the ability of the AppleTV to play video podcasts–may be the most important announcement because it opens a path for free, ad-supported programs from many sources to get onto televisions.
lead_paragraph: While Steve Jobs talked for a long time Tuesday at Macworld Expo about the movie rental feature of iTunes and Apple TV, he spent only a short time demonstrating its capabilities for podcasts. In fact, the ability of Apple TV to view podcasts may in the long run be its most important feature.

headline.main: Video Podcasts: The Sleeping Giant on AppleTV
